    • Method Detail

      • onCreate

        public void onCreate(android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
        This function will be called on Activity Creation. It initializes the views, attached to the Layout and sets current Properties: * it initializes the Map * it initializes a hidden list, which will be populated when the user types something into the Edit-Text field editLocationInput * it sets a TouchListener on the Map to handle Location * sets the current location as a marker
        Overrides:
        onCreate in class android.app.Activity
        Parameters:
        savedInstanceState - the state of the Activity when it has been opened before

      • onDestroy

        protected void onDestroy()
        Called on Destruction of the Activity The Activity gets removed from the stack -> registers removal to the app
        Overrides:
        onDestroy in class android.app.Activity

      • onResume

        public void onResume()
        Called on Resume of the Activity The Activity will be added on top of the stack (-> registration) to the app
        Overrides:
        onResume in class android.app.Activity

      • onPause

        public void onPause()
        Called on Pause of the Activity The Activity will be removed from top of the stack (-> registration to the app)
        Overrides:
        onPause in class android.app.Activity

      • updateCurrentMarker

        public void updateCurrentMarker(org.osmdroid.views.overlay.Marker marker)
        updateCurrentMarker() will handle the selection of a specific marker (provided by argument. * If the marker is the same as the current location, it will remove the previous selection. * If there is no previous selection (marker) it will close the info window of the marker, representing current location and will set the selected Marker to the marker provided by the argument * if the current selection is the same as a custom selected location from the map, it will remove the previous selected marker from the map. * Else, the previous selected marker is a marker loaded from the text-input and has to be kept on the map. It will only close the info window of the previous marker.
        Parameters:
        marker - marker to be set as current selection

      • setMarker

        public void setMarker(TripLocation location,
                      MapActivity.MARKERTYPE markertype,
                      boolean center)
        A marker will be added to the map with the location, provided by argument. The markers icon will be set based on the argument : * CURRENT: current location of this device * SELECTED: Selection by the user (either from laoded markers or picked from the map) * LOADED: Loaded by typing in the search field.
        Parameters:
        location - location of the marker to be set
        markertype - type of the marker
        center - indicates, whether the map as to be centered around the new marker

      • loadMarkers

        public void loadMarkers(java.util.List<TripLocation> locationList)
        This function is used to load several Markers. The Markers get determined by locationList, provided by Argument.
        Parameters:
        locationList - List of TripLocations to draw to the map

      • loadMarkers

        public void loadMarkers(java.lang.String locationName)
        This function sets Markers, identified by a specific location name, to the map (The location name provided by Location-Search) This is done by calling the Rest-API of Photon, which will result for a List of Locations with a given location name.
        Parameters:
        locationName -

      • setMarkerClickListener

        public void setMarkerClickListener(org.osmdroid.views.overlay.Marker marker)
        Sets the Click Listener of the Marker. When a Marker is selected the Info-Window of the Previous selected Marker will be closed and the marker ( provided by argument) will be the current Selected Marker (field currentSelectedMarker).
        Parameters:
        marker -

      • onLocationSelected

        public void onLocationSelected(android.view.View view)
        This is called when the Button within the InfoWindow of the current selected Marker (currentSelectedMarker) is clicked. It will result in building a TripLocation and returning it to the MainActivity
        Parameters:
        view -

      • determineBoundingBox

        public static org.osmdroid.util.BoundingBox determineBoundingBox(java.util.List<TripLocation> locationList)
        Determines the Bounding Box of a List of TripLocations. This is the Frame on the Map, so that all locations (list provided by argument) can be shown. It is determined by the * highest coordinate for the top border * lowest coordinate for the bottom border * most left coordinate for the left border * most right coordinate for the right border of the frame. This is done by determining the max and minLatitude and Longtitude of all TripLocations in the locationList.
        Parameters:
        locationList - to determine the Bounding Box for.
        Returns:
        a BoundingBox where all TripLocation of the List will be shown
